intro: Cardamine hilariana, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and is characterized by its delicate, kidney-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. It has a short growing season and is adapted to cold climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
